verses.kjv: At the same time, saith the LORD, will I be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be my people.
verses.web: “At that time,” says LORD, “I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they will be my people.”
verses.ct: "When that time comes," declares the LORD, "I will be the God of every family in Israel, and they will be my people."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, The people which were left of the sword found grace in the wilderness; even Israel, when I went to cause him to rest.
verses.web: LORD says, “The people who survive the sword found favor in the wilderness; even Israel, when I went to cause him to rest.”
verses.ct: The LORD says, "The people who survived the sword found grace in the wilderness — Israel found it when I led them to a place of rest."

verses.kjv: The LORD hath appeared of old unto me, saying, Yea, I have loved thee with an everlasting love: therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn thee.
verses.web: LORD appeared of old to me, saying, “Yes, I have loved you with an everlasting love. Therefore I have drawn you with loving kindness.
verses.ct: The LORD appeared to me long ago and said, "Yes, I have loved you with an everlasting love. That's why I've drawn you to myself with unfailing kindness."

verses.kjv: Again I will build thee, and thou shalt be built, O virgin of Israel: thou shalt again be adorned with thy tabrets, and shalt go forth in the dances of them that make merry.
verses.web: I will build you again, and you will be built, O virgin of Israel. You will again be adorned with your tambourines, and will go out in the dances of those who make merry.
verses.ct: "I will rebuild you, and you will be rebuilt, O virgin Israel. You'll pick up your tambourines again and dance with joy."

verses.kjv: Thou shalt yet plant vines upon the mountains of Samaria: the planters shall plant, and shall eat them as common things.
verses.web: Again you will plant vineyards on the mountains of Samaria. The planters will plant, and will enjoy its fruit.
verses.ct: "You will plant vineyards once more on the mountains of Samaria. Those who plant them will live to enjoy the fruit."

verses.kjv: For there shall be a day, that the watchmen upon the mount Ephraim shall cry, Arise ye, and let us go up to Zion unto the LORD our God.
verses.web: For there will be a day that the watchmen on the hills of Ephraim cry, ‘Arise! Let’s go up to Zion to LORD our God.’ ”
verses.ct: "A day is coming when watchmen on the hills of Ephraim will shout, 'Come on! Let's go up to Zion, to the LORD our God!'"

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD; Sing with gladness for Jacob, and shout among the chief of the nations: publish ye, praise ye, and say, O LORD, save thy people, the remnant of Israel.
verses.web: For LORD says, “Sing with gladness for Jacob, and shout for the chief of the nations. Publish, praise, and say, ‘LORD, save your people, the remnant of Israel!’
verses.ct: The LORD says, "Sing with joy for Jacob! Shout for the greatest of nations! Let your praise be heard: 'LORD, save your people, the remnant of Israel!'"

verses.kjv: Behold, I will bring them from the north country, and gather them from the coasts of the earth, and with them the blind and the lame, the woman with child and her that travaileth with child together: a great company shall return thither.
verses.web: Behold, I will bring them from the north country, and gather them from the uttermost parts of the earth, along with the blind and the lame, the woman with child and her who travails with child together. They will return as a great company.
verses.ct: "Watch — I will bring them back from the north and gather them from the farthest corners of the earth. The blind and the lame will come, along with pregnant women and those in labor. A vast crowd will return."

verses.kjv: They shall come with weeping, and with supplications will I lead them: I will cause them to walk by the rivers of waters in a straight way, wherein they shall not stumble: for I am a father to Israel, and Ephraim is my firstborn.
verses.web: They will come with weeping. I will lead them with petitions. I will cause them to walk by rivers of waters, in a straight way in which they won’t stumble; for I am a father to Israel. Ephraim is my firstborn.
verses.ct: "They will come weeping, pouring out prayers as I lead them home. I will guide them along streams of water on a level road where they won't stumble, because I am a father to Israel, and Ephraim is my firstborn son."

verses.kjv: Hear the word of the LORD, O ye nations, and declare it in the isles afar off, and say, He that scattered Israel will gather him, and keep him, as a shepherd doth his flock.
verses.web: “Hear LORD’s word, you nations, and declare it in the distant islands. Say, ‘He who scattered Israel will gather him, and keep him, as a shepherd does his flock.’
verses.ct: "Listen to the word of the LORD, you nations! Announce it on distant shores: 'The one who scattered Israel will gather them back and watch over them like a shepherd guards his flock.'"

verses.kjv: For the LORD hath redeemed Jacob, and ransomed him from the hand of him that was stronger than he.
verses.web: For LORD has ransomed Jacob, and redeemed him from the hand of him who was stronger than he.
verses.ct: The LORD has rescued Jacob and freed him from an enemy too powerful for him.

verses.kjv: Therefore they shall come and sing in the height of Zion, and shall flow together to the goodness of the LORD, for wheat, and for wine, and for oil, and for the young of the flock and of the herd: and their soul shall be as a watered garden; and they shall not sorrow any more at all.
verses.web: They will come and sing in the height of Zion, and will flow to the goodness of LORD, to the grain, to the new wine, to the oil, and to the young of the flock and of the herd. Their soul will be as a watered garden. They will not sorrow any more at all.
verses.ct: They will come and sing for joy on the heights of Zion, streaming toward the LORD's goodness — the grain, the new wine, the olive oil, the young lambs and calves. Their soul will be like a well-watered garden, and they will never grieve again.

verses.kjv: Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance, both young men and old together: for I will turn their mourning into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow.
verses.web: Then the virgin will rejoice in the dance; the young men and the old together; for I will turn their mourning into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow.
verses.ct: Young women will dance with joy, and young men and old will celebrate together. I will turn their mourning into gladness, comfort them, and replace their sorrow with rejoicing.

verses.kjv: And I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness, and my people shall be satisfied with my goodness, saith the LORD.
verses.web: I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness, and my people will be satisfied with my goodness,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "I will fill the priests with abundance, and my people will be satisfied with my goodness," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, and bitter weeping; Rahel weeping for her children refused to be comforted for her children, because they were not.
verses.web: LORD says: “A voice is heard in Ramah, lamentation and bitter weeping, Rachel weeping for her children. She refuses to be comforted for her children, because they are no more.”
verses.ct: The LORD says, "A voice is heard in Ramah — bitter crying and weeping. Rachel is weeping for her children, refusing to be comforted, because they are gone."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Refrain thy voice from weeping, and thine eyes from tears: for thy work shall be rewarded, saith the LORD; and they shall come again from the land of the enemy.
verses.web: LORD says: “Refrain your voice from weeping, and your eyes from tears; for your work will be rewarded,” says LORD. “They will come again from the land of the enemy.
verses.ct: The LORD says, "Stop your weeping and dry your tears, because your suffering will be rewarded," declares the LORD. "Your children will return from the enemy's land."

verses.kjv: And there is hope in thine end, saith the LORD, that thy children shall come again to their own border.
verses.web: There is hope for your latter end,” says LORD. “Your children will come again to their own territory.
verses.ct: "There is hope for your future," declares the LORD. "Your children will come back to their own land."

verses.kjv: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself thus; Thou hast chastised me, and I was chastised, as a bullock unaccustomed to the yoke: turn thou me, and I shall be turned; for thou art the LORD my God.
verses.web: “I have surely heard Ephraim grieving thus, ‘You have chastised me, and I was chastised, as an untrained calf. Turn me, and I will be turned; for you are LORD my God.
verses.ct: "I have clearly heard Ephraim grieving: 'You disciplined me, and I deserved it — I was like an untrained calf fighting the yoke. Bring me back, and I will return, because you are the LORD my God."

verses.kjv: Surely after that I was turned, I repented; and after that I was instructed, I smote upon my thigh: I was ashamed, yea, even confounded, because I did bear the reproach of my youth.
verses.web: Surely after that I was turned. I repented. After that I was instructed. I struck my thigh. I was ashamed, yes, even confounded, because I bore the reproach of my youth.’
verses.ct: "After I strayed, I repented. After I understood, I struck my thigh in shame. I was humiliated and disgraced because I carried the guilt of my younger days.'"

verses.kjv: Is Ephraim my dear son? is he a pleasant child? for since I spake against him, I do earnestly remember him still: therefore my bowels are troubled for him; I will surely have mercy upon him, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Is Ephraim my dear son? Is he a darling child? For as often as I speak against him, I still earnestly remember him. therefore my heart yearns for him. I will surely have mercy on him,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Is Ephraim not my precious son? Is he not a child I delight in? Even though I often speak against him, I still think about him constantly. My heart aches for him. I will surely have mercy on him," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Set thee up waymarks, make thee high heaps: set thine heart toward the highway, even the way which thou wentest: turn again, O virgin of Israel, turn again to these thy cities.
verses.web: “Set up road signs. Make guideposts. Set your heart toward the highway, even the way by which you went. Turn again, virgin of Israel. Turn again to these your cities.
verses.ct: "Set up road markers and put up guideposts for yourself. Pay attention to the highway — the road you traveled before. Come back, virgin Israel! Return to your cities."

verses.kjv: How long wilt thou go about, O thou backsliding daughter? for the LORD hath created a new thing in the earth, A woman shall compass a man.
verses.web: How long will you go here and there, you backsliding daughter? For LORD has created a new thing in the earth: a woman will encompass a man.”
verses.ct: "How long will you wander, you unfaithful daughter? The LORD has created something brand new on the earth: a woman will embrace a man."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; As yet they shall use this speech in the land of Judah and in the cities thereof, when I shall bring again their captivity; The LORD bless thee, O habitation of justice, and mountain of holiness.
verses.web: LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Yet again they will use this speech in the land of Judah and in its cities, when I reverse their captivity: ‘LORD bless you, habitation of righteousness, mountain of holiness.’
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says, "When I restore their fortunes, people in the land of Judah and its cities will once again say, 'May the LORD bless you, home of righteousness, mountain of holiness.'"

verses.kjv: And there shall dwell in Judah itself, and in all the cities thereof together, husbandmen, and they that go forth with flocks.
verses.web: Judah and all its cities will dwell therein together, the farmers, and those who go about with flocks.
verses.ct: "Farmers and shepherds with their flocks will live together in Judah and all its cities."

verses.kjv: For I have satiated the weary soul, and I have replenished every sorrowful soul.
verses.web: For I have satiated the weary soul, and I have replenished every sorrowful soul.”
verses.ct: "I will refresh the weary soul and satisfy every soul that is filled with sorrow."

verses.kjv: Upon this I awaked, and beheld; and my sleep was sweet unto me.
verses.web: On this I awakened, and saw; and my sleep was sweet to me.
verses.ct: At this I woke up and looked around, and my sleep had been peaceful.

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of beast.
verses.web: “Behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and with the seed of animal.
verses.ct: "The days are coming," declares the LORD, "when I will fill the land of Israel and Judah with many people and many animals."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that like as I have watched over them, to pluck up, and to break down, and to throw down, and to destroy, and to afflict; so will I watch over them, to build, and to plant, saith the LORD.
verses.web: It will happen that, like as I have watched over them to pluck up and to break down and to overthrow and to destroy and to afflict, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Just as I watched over them to uproot, tear down, overthrow, destroy, and bring disaster, so I will watch over them to build up and to plant," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: In those days they shall say no more, The fathers have eaten a sour grape, and the children’s teeth are set on edge.
verses.web: “In those days they will say no more, “ ‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are set on edge.’
verses.ct: "In those days, people will no longer say, 'The parents ate sour grapes, and their children's teeth ache because of it.'"

verses.kjv: But every one shall die for his own iniquity: every man that eateth the sour grape, his teeth shall be set on edge.
verses.web: But everyone will die for his own iniquity. Every man who eats the sour grapes, his teeth will be set on edge.
verses.ct: "Instead, each person will die for their own sin. Whoever eats the sour grapes — their own teeth will ache."

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah:
verses.web: “Behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah:
verses.ct: "The days are coming," declares the LORD, "when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah."

verses.kjv: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt; which my covenant they brake, although I was an husband unto them, saith the LORD:
verses.web: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt; which covenant of mine they broke, although I was a husband to them,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "It won't be like the covenant I made with their ancestors when I took them by the hand and led them out of Egypt — a covenant they broke, even though I was like a husband to them," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: But this shall be the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel; After those days, saith the LORD, I will put my law in their inward parts, and write it in their hearts; and will be their God, and they shall be my people.
verses.web: “But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days,” says LORD: “I will put my law in their inward parts, and I will write it in their heart. I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
verses.ct: "Instead, this is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after those days," declares the LORD. "I will put my law inside them and write it on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be my people."

verses.kjv: And they shall teach no more every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the LORD: for they shall all know me, from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith the LORD: for I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.
verses.web: They will no longer each teach his neighbor, and every man teach his brother, saying, ‘Know LORD;’ for they will all know me, from their least to their greatest,” says LORD: “for I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.”
verses.ct: "No one will need to teach their neighbor or their brother, saying, 'Know the LORD,' because they will all know me — from the least important to the most important," declares the LORD. "I will forgive their wrongdoing and never remember their sin again."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, which giveth the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, which divideth the sea when the waves thereof roar; The LORD of hosts is his name:
verses.web: LORD, who gives the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, who stirs up the sea, so that its waves roar; LORD of Armies is his name, says:
verses.ct: The LORD — who gives the sun to light the day and sets the moon and stars to light the night, who stirs up the sea until its waves roar, whose name is the LORD of hosts — says this:

verses.kjv: If those ordinances depart from before me, saith the LORD, then the seed of Israel also shall cease from being a nation before me for ever.
verses.web: “If these ordinances depart from before me,” says LORD, “then the offspring of Israel also will cease from being a nation before me forever.”
verses.ct: "If these laws of nature ever stop working," declares the LORD, "only then will Israel's descendants stop being a nation in my presence forever."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, I will also cast off all the seed of Israel for all that they have done, saith the LORD.
verses.web: LORD says: “If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, then I will also cast off all the offspring of Israel for all that they have done,” says LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD says, "If the heavens above could be measured and the foundations of the earth below could be explored, only then would I reject all of Israel's descendants for everything they have done," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that the city shall be built to the LORD from the tower of Hananeel unto the gate of the corner.
verses.web: “Behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that the city will be built to LORD from the tower of Hananel to the gate of the corner.
verses.ct: "The days are coming," declares the LORD, "when this city will be rebuilt for the LORD, from the tower of Hananeel to the Corner Gate."

verses.kjv: And the measuring line shall yet go forth over against it upon the hill Gareb, and shall compass about to Goath.
verses.web: The measuring line will go out further straight onward to the hill Gareb, and will turn toward Goah.
verses.ct: "The measuring line will stretch out straight to the hill of Gareb and then turn toward Goath."

verses.kjv: And the whole valley of the dead bodies, and of the ashes, and all the fields unto the brook of Kidron, unto the corner of the horse gate toward the east, shall be holy unto the LORD; it shall not be plucked up, nor thrown down any more for ever.
verses.web: The whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields to the brook Kidron, to the corner of the horse gate toward the east, will be holy to LORD. It will not be plucked up or thrown down any more forever.”
verses.ct: "The entire valley where dead bodies and ashes were thrown, and all the fields out to the Kidron brook and over to the corner of the Horse Gate on the east — all of it will be holy to the LORD. It will never be torn down or destroyed again."
